data.Occ_Desc: Directs the fiscal functions of the company. Monitors, controls and reports the financial assets and results. Oversees the financial and operating strategy as well as risk management. Serves on the Executive Committee and acts as a business partner to the CEO and supports the development of the company’s overall strategic plan. Often has responsibility for human resources, procurement, administration, and information systems.

Plays an ownership role in financial planning, management reporting and financial analytics efforts across the company, including consolidation of plans and forecasts for an enterprise outlook. Provides senior and executive management with financial reporting and analysis to be used in strategic and tactical decision making. Gathers business performance data, analyzes and compares it to previous periods, and develops recommendations for improvements in revenue growth or resource allocation. Works with various members of the operational and finance executive teams, the Board of Directors and, potentially, the investment community.

Contributes to the company’s success by providing timely advice on strategy and operations. Drives the FP&A teams to elevate existing processes and tools in order to meet the needs of future growth. Oversees the development and implementation of effective, integrated systems for budgeting, payables, reporting and auditing revenues, expenditures and asset accountability. Reports directly to VP Finance or Treasurer.

Analyzes operational, commercial, strategic and financial data/metrics in order to provide insightful analysis to drive management actions and initiatives and the planning process. Performs financial analyses in line with corporate goals and allocates capital to its most efficient place. Becomes a trusted advisor to the supported unit.

Is responsible for providing senior leadership team with timely financial and operational analysis to facilitate sound business decisions. Focuses on the strategic plan, budgeting, monthly forecasting and consolidated financial reporting. Conducts and documents financial analysis projects, data gathering, manipulation, summarization, and analysis of financial reports, sales activity, trends and opportunities.

Serves as part of the Finance team and is responsible for providing granular data and analysis on business issues, planning, budgeting and forecasting across the company for management’s use in strategic and tactical decision making. Represents the finance point-of-view in helping the department make sound business decisions. Reports to the FP&A Manager and works closely with the business units that FP&A supports.

Responsible for the oversight of the receivables management area including cash management, collections and refunds, as well as investments’ middle-office operations. Manages activities surrounding financial reporting, tax compliance, international accounting and consolidations and cash management planning in domestic and international efforts. This individual is often part of the Executive team and typically reports directly to the CFO.

Is responsible for the determination of cash requirements, cash concentration, short-term cash investments and maintenance of appropriate cash flow. Establishes short-term borrowing needs and recommends short-term investing initiatives. Directs and manages operations of the Treasury function and prepares and analyzes departments report, financial accounting records, cash flow analysis, credit agreement compliance and projections.

Leads risk management audits. Is responsible for the overall planning, organizing and execution of all risk management functions. Manages company-wide risk management program. Formulates and recommends insurance strategy.

Responsible for the planning and execution of day-to-day and period-end Treasury activities including managing the company’s cash flow forecast, identifying cost-saving and profit maximizing opportunities and ensuring compliance with company, department and audit standards to maximize the protection of the company’s cash assets. Partners with the Assistant Treasurer to create the vision, strategy and standards by which the Treasury department provides leadership and value to the organization. Manages all banking needs.

Reports to the Treasury Manager, Assistant Treasurer or Treasurer. Facilitates daily treasury operations, provides accurate cash reporting and assists with bank structure management and some risk management activities. Produces reports to aid in the forecasting of cash needs for the business and assists with other Treasury functions. Works cross functionally with the Finance team to identify FX exposures and support the hedging program.

Monitors and confirms company’s financial condition by conducting audits and providing information for external audits. Directs financial accounting activities of the organization and decisions by enforcing policies and procedures. Oversees general ledger, accounts payable, accounts receivable, cash accounting, financial statement reporting, external audit, tax filings and monitors budgeted expenditures. Supervises accounting team and reports to the CFO.

Develops and maintains an organization’s accounting policies and procedures. Plans, organizes, and coordinates the year-end close process with internal and external auditors. Typically reports to the CFO or Controller.

Responsible for the first-level review of global general ledger accounting balance sheet reconciliations and preparing global balance sheet variance analysis. Oversees the monthly, quarterly and annual close process and develops policies and procedures to ensure proper accounting company-wide. Oversees the day-to-day accounting. Is instrumental in running and producing daily, weekly and monthly reporting. Directs and manages the accounting staff.

Main duties include utilizing the company’s financial data in the preparation of general ledger journal entries. Helps prepare the budget and analyze the monthly financial statements for variances. Assists in tax report filings, asset allocations and forecasting. Examines accounting documents for accuracy and ensures compliance with policies, procedures and accounting standards.

Is responsible for assisting with both clerical and administrative tasks. Participates in verifying the accuracy of invoices, updating and maintaining accounting ledgers, and investigating data inconsistencies. This position is an entry level role within the Accounting function.

Responsible for designing, developing, and implementing internal auditing policies consistent with the organization’s standards and goals. Identifies improper accounting or documentation and makes recommendations for improvement to top management. The Vice President of Audit typically reports to the CFO or other top management.

Implements the internal auditing policies and procedures consistent with the organization’s standards and defined by executive management. Manages and oversees Audit Managers and other Audit staff to ensure compliance with laws and regulations. The Director of Audit typically reports to the CFO or other top management.

Manages the process of examining records to determine the financial status of a company or organization. Inspects accounts and account books, prepares reports on the accuracy of internal financial records and accounting procedures. May supervise accountants and bookkeepers during the auditing process. Directs and manages the audit staff.

Examines records to determine the financial status of a company or organization. Inspects accounts and account books, prepares reports on the accuracy of internal financial records and accounting procedures. Responsible for verifying company assets and liabilities, compiling with laws and regulations, and proposing new processes for financial improvement. Reports to the Audit Manager or Director of Audit.

Ensures compliance with all federal, state, and local tax regulations while working to minimize tax liability. Plans and directs all aspects of an organization’s tax policies and objectives. Provides the executive management team with analysis to be used in strategic decision-making. The Vice President of Tax typically reports to the CFO or other top management.

Helps ensure compliance with all federal, state, and local tax regulations while working to minimize tax liability. Oversees Tax Managers and other Tax staff to ensure compliance with the organization’s tax policies and objectives. The Director of Tax typically reports to the Vice President of Tax or other top executives.

Manages tax reporting and advises on tax planning for a company. Maintains current knowledge of federal, state and local tax codes and ensure that company tax filings are in compliance with the law. Manages tax accounting staff.

Organizes tax-related information and prepares tax returns. Monitors tax regulations and advises on tax issues that affect business. May assist with preparation for a tax audit. May specialize in complex topics related to corporate taxes or trusts and estates.
Top_Emerging_Skills: Computer and Information Technology Industry Knowledge

data.Occ_Desc: Specializes in reviewing tax liability and tax practices for a company. Maintains current knowledge of federal, state, and local tax laws and codes. Assists with company tax filings, monitors compliance with tax codes, and identifies opportunities for tax savings.
